text:
We use fop to generate pdf files of our contents.
In some case, the generated pdf crash some versions of acrobat reader.
I joined the generated pdf, I can join a "fo" file that the pdf file crashed acrobat, if needed.

Thanks for your work.
creator: nahuel.angelinetti@revues.org
bowditch_chris@hotmail.com
text:
Hi,

Please can you attach a sample XSL-FO File that demonstrates the issue so we can analyze the cause of the crash?

Thanks,

Chris

creator: nahuel.angelinetti@revues.org
text:
Created attachment 26905
XSL that crash acrobat reader

creator: nahuel.angelinetti@revues.org
text: I joined two files, a pdf generated that crash acrobat reader, and the xsl-fo associated.

creator: bowditch_chris@hotmail.com
text: The PDF opened fine without crashing for me. What version of Acrobat Reader are you using and what Operating System?
It doesn't crash on linux with acrobat 9. But it crash on 8.2 Pro.
creator: nahuel.angelinetti@revues.org
gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition resolved+wontfix to closed+wontfix; if you believe this remains a bug and can demonstrate it with appropriate input FO file and output PDF file (as applicable), then you may reopen
